basics.name: Kai Matsusaka
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Department of Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

highlights: Graded assignments for EE205, a course on Object Oriented Programming taught in C and C++
Altered homework assignments and projects to fix live issues and bugs
Suggested alterations for course to be implemented in 2024
Assisted farmers with simple daily duties such as cleaning, upkeep, and organization of equipment
Assisted with cleaning, maintenance, upkeep, and minor construction of college rental homes

volunteer.summary: Assisted in developing the skills of high school athletes into a team of strong and coordinated paddlers. Ran land and water drills, as well as being a Pac-5 team representative for the ILH race safety boat.

Worked with new and experienced student kayakers to give them an opportunity to compete in highschool competitions. Ran land and water drills, and was a part of the ILH race timing crew during competitions.

awards.title: University of Hawaii at Manoa Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to students with a GPA of over 3.5 and over 12 credits.

awards.title: University of Hawaii at Manoa Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum 3.8 GPA.
